requirement_tested: A frontend application that fetches all dynamic data from backend APIs
user_persona: A trivia enthusiast who wants to explore available contests.
user_goal: To navigate to the Contests page and view the list of available trivia contests fetched from the backend.

narrative_steps.title: Navigating to Contests Page
narrative_steps.description: Sarah opens the app and wants to see what trivia contests are available. She clicks on the 'Contests' link in the navigation bar.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Contests' navigation link.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The URL updates and the content area dynamically loads the contests page, displaying a grid of contest cards fetched from the backend API.

requirement_tested: A backend API server that connects to a PostgreSQL database using specified environment variables
user_persona: A developer checking if the backend is properly connected to the database.
user_goal: To verify that the backend server can successfully connect to the PostgreSQL database using the specified environment variables.

narrative_steps.title: Starting Backend Server
narrative_steps.description: The developer starts the backend server which attempts to establish a connection to the PostgreSQL database using the environment variables.
narrative_steps.action: Start the backend server using `npm run dev`.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The server initializes successfully and logs a message indicating a successful connection to the PostgreSQL database at localhost:5432 with the specified credentials.

requirement_tested: User authentication and session management system
user_persona: A returning user who wants to log in to participate in a contest.
user_goal: To log in to the application using valid credentials and gain access to the dashboard.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Login Page
narrative_steps.description: Alex visits the app and wants to log in. He finds and clicks the 'Login' button.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Login' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The login form with username/email and password fields is displayed.

narrative_steps.title: Submitting Credentials
narrative_steps.description: Alex enters his valid username and password and submits the form.
narrative_steps.action: Enter valid username and password, then click the 'Submit' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The system authenticates Alex, stores a JWT token, and redirects him to the dashboard with a welcome message.

user_persona: A user looking for a specific type of trivia contest.
user_goal: To find contests by applying filters and browsing the results.

narrative_steps.title: Applying Filters
narrative_steps.description: Jamie wants to find easy-level Science contests. She selects 'Science' under category and 'Easy' under difficulty level.
narrative_steps.action: Select 'Science' from category dropdown and 'Easy' from difficulty dropdown.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The contest list updates dynamically to show only contests matching the selected filters.

narrative_steps.title: Browsing Results
narrative_steps.description: Jamie scrolls through the filtered contest list to find one she likes.
narrative_steps.action: Scroll through the filtered contest list.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Additional contest cards load progressively as Jamie scrolls down the list.

user_persona: A user ready to join a contest.
user_goal: To enroll in a selected trivia contest and get confirmation.

narrative_steps.title: Viewing Contest Details
narrative_steps.description: Taylor clicks on a contest card to see more details about it.
narrative_steps.action: Click on a contest card.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The contest details page loads, showing title, description, schedule, and an 'Enroll Now' button.

narrative_steps.title: Enrolling in Contest
narrative_steps.description: Taylor decides to join the contest and clicks the 'Enroll Now' button.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Enroll Now' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A confirmation modal appears, confirming successful enrollment and offering a link to the contest lobby.

requirement_tested: Interactive question display interface for live contests
user_persona: A contestant participating in a live trivia contest.
user_goal: To answer contest questions and navigate through them until submission.

narrative_steps.title: Answering First Question
narrative_steps.description: Jordan is in a live contest and sees the first multiple-choice question. He selects an answer.
narrative_steps.action: Select an answer option for the first question.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The selected option is visually highlighted, and the 'Next Question' button becomes active.

narrative_steps.title: Navigating Questions
narrative_steps.description: Jordan clicks 'Next Question' to move to the second question.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Next Question' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The second question is loaded, preserving his previous answer selection.

narrative_steps.title: Submitting Final Answer
narrative_steps.description: On the last question, Jordan selects his answer and clicks 'Submit Answers'.
narrative_steps.action: Select answer for last question and click 'Submit Answers'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All answers are submitted to the backend, and Jordan is redirected to the score summary screen.

user_persona: A contestant who accidentally skips a question.
user_goal: To be prompted to fill in missing answers before submitting.

narrative_steps.title: Skipping a Question
narrative_steps.description: Casey is answering questions but accidentally skips one and tries to proceed.
narrative_steps.action: Attempt to click 'Next Question' without selecting an answer.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: An inline error message appears below the unanswered question, and the input field is highlighted in red.

narrative_steps.title: Correcting and Proceeding
narrative_steps.description: Casey fills in the skipped answer and tries again.
narrative_steps.action: Select an answer and click 'Next Question'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The error message disappears, and the next question loads successfully.

user_persona: A contestant wanting immediate feedback on performance.
user_goal: To see real-time score updates as answers are processed.

narrative_steps.title: Submitting Answers
narrative_steps.description: Morgan finishes answering all questions and submits her responses.
narrative_steps.action: Click 'Submit Answers' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A WebSocket connection is established to receive real-time score updates.

narrative_steps.title: Receiving Score Updates
narrative_steps.description: As answers are processed, Morgan sees her score updating live on the scoreboard.
narrative_steps.action: Wait for WebSocket events to trigger score updates.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The displayed score value increases dynamically without requiring a page reload.

requirement_tested: Leaderboard showing user rankings and scores
user_persona: A competitive player checking how they rank against others.
user_goal: To view the leaderboard and see their position among other contestants.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Leaderboard
narrative_steps.description: Riley wants to see how he ranks compared to others. He navigates to the leaderboard page.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Leaderboard' navigation link.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The leaderboard page loads, showing a ranked list of contestants sorted by score and completion time.

narrative_steps.title: Browsing Rankings
narrative_steps.description: Riley scrolls through the leaderboard to find his name.
narrative_steps.action: Scroll down the leaderboard list.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Additional entries load progressively as Riley scrolls, maintaining smooth performance.

requirement_tested: User profile page displaying personal stats and contest history
user_persona: A user reviewing their past performance.
user_goal: To view personal statistics and detailed history of participated contests.

narrative_steps.title: Visiting Profile Page
narrative_steps.description: Casey wants to review his overall performance. He navigates to his profile page.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Profile' navigation link.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The profile dashboard loads, showing performance summary cards and recent contest history.

narrative_steps.title: Checking Contest Details
narrative_steps.description: Casey clicks on a recent contest entry to see detailed results.
narrative_steps.action: Click on a contest entry in the history section.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A detailed result view opens, showing question-by-question breakdown of his answers.

requirement_tested: Admin panel for creating and managing trivia contests
user_persona: An administrator setting up new trivia contests.
user_goal: To create a new trivia contest using the admin panel.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Admin Panel
narrative_steps.description: Admin Sam logs in and accesses the admin dashboard to create a new contest.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to /admin/contests after logging in with admin privileges.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The admin dashboard loads with a sidebar menu showing administrative modules and a list of existing contests.

narrative_steps.title: Creating New Contest
narrative_steps.description: Sam clicks to create a new contest and fills out the contest creation form.
narrative_steps.action: Click 'Create New Contest' and fill in title, description, category, difficulty, start date, duration, and questions.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A multi-step form wizard opens, allowing Sam to configure and save the new contest as a draft or published version.

requirement_tested: Database schema supporting users, contests, questions, answers, and scores
user_persona: A database administrator verifying table relationships.
user_goal: To confirm that database tables are correctly structured with proper relationships.

narrative_steps.title: Inspecting Database Tables
narrative_steps.description: DBA Taylor connects to the PostgreSQL database to inspect the schema structure.
narrative_steps.action: Query the database to show table schemas and relationships.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Tables for users, contests, questions, answers, and scores are found with appropriate columns and foreign key constraints enforcing referential integrity.

requirement_tested: Responsive UI design with beige as base color and saddle brown for components
user_persona: A mobile user accessing the app on a smartphone.
user_goal: To use the app comfortably on a mobile device with consistent styling.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing App on Mobile
narrative_steps.description: Alex opens the app on his smartphone and navigates to the homepage.
narrative_steps.action: Load the app on a mobile device with screen width < 768px.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The layout adjusts to a stacked mobile view with hamburger menu icon, maintaining beige background and saddle brown component accents.

narrative_steps.title: Resizing to Desktop
narrative_steps.description: Alex switches to desktop view to see how the layout adapts.
narrative_steps.action: Resize browser window to > 1024px width.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The layout transitions to a side-by-side desktop arrangement while preserving consistent color scheme and styling.

requirement_tested: Package.json configured with npm run install:all for frontend and backend installation
user_persona: A developer setting up the project for the first time.
user_goal: To install all frontend and backend dependencies with a single command.

narrative_steps.title: Installing Dependencies
narrative_steps.description: Developer Jordan clones the repository and needs to install all dependencies.
narrative_steps.action: Run `npm run install:all` in the root directory.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Both frontend and backend dependencies are installed concurrently, with terminal output showing progress from both installations.

requirement_tested: Package.json configured with npm run dev for concurrent frontend and backend development servers
user_persona: A developer starting development work on the project.
user_goal: To launch both frontend and backend development servers simultaneously.

narrative_steps.title: Starting Development Servers
narrative_steps.description: Developer Morgan is ready to start coding and needs to run both frontend and backend servers.
narrative_steps.action: Run `npm run dev` in the root directory.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Both the Vite frontend development server and Node/Nodemon backend server start concurrently, with unified terminal output showing both processes running.
